intro: Symplocos flos-pilosa, commonly known as the hairy flowered evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant produces small, dark berries that are edible and contain seeds.
